title: An Easily Accessible Physical Activity Training Program for Patients With Alzheimer's Dementia: Effect on Clinical and Neurobiological Parameters (MOTODEM)
description_brief: The purpose of this study is to determine if a home based physical activity training program for patients with Alzheimer's dementia has effects on clinical and neurobiological parameters.
explanation_target: Reason: The intervention described is a home‑based physical activity (exercise) training program for patients with Alzheimer’s dementia — a behavioral/non‑pharmacologic intervention intended to affect clinical and neurobiological parameters. This is not a biologic or small molecule drug, nor a pharmacologic cognitive enhancer or a drug for neuropsychiatric symptoms. citeturn1search1turn1search7

Act: Key trial details extracted — Title/MOTODEM, registration NCT02196545, lead sponsor Technische Universität Dresden, intervention classified as Behavioral: Exercise (movement trainer, training ~3×/week for 30 min in the pilot RCT), enrollment ~30; results and methods published (pilot RCT report available). No investigational drug or placebo is listed. citeturn1search1turn1search7turn1search0

Reflect: Classification check — per the provided category definitions, this trial is a non‑drug exercise intervention (diagnostic/non‑therapeutic category for our classification task). It does not fit any of the four drug/biology‑based categories, so the correct label is 'N/A'. Supporting sources (trial registry and published pilot RCT) confirm the behavioral nature of the intervention and absence of a drug/placebo. citeturn1search1turn1search7
